title: 210  Taking to Krishna consciousness is not easy
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.text: So, one has to be extremely determined. It requires patience, lots of patience to make
even one soul a devotee. Don't think that immediately I will tell, I will meet my friend
and I will explain all logic and arguments everything and now he will understand Krishna
consciousness, not like that.
Krishna is telling those have stopped all sinful activities. They should have sufficient
Punya. Only they will be free from Moha, this Maya's Moha.
Dvandva, duality and delusion. And Bhajan, Temam, they will take up to devotion to Krishna.
So taking up devotional service to Krishna is not at all easy. And Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's
desire is to give this Bhakti, Krishna Bhakti or Krishna Prema to one and all irrespective
of their present material position, whatever they may be. She is not saying are you Brahmana,
are you, you have enough Punya or not.
She is not checking and giving. She is simply distributing Krishna Bhakti to one and all.
And Lord Chaitanya is telling, I alone cannot distribute. I mean, I want all of you to take
up this task and simply distribute these fruits of Krishna consciousness. This Hare Krishna
mantra is the fruit which we have to distribute to everyone. You taste it and you distribute
it also. This is the desire of Lord Chaitanya and Chaitanya Mahaprabhu will be very happy.
So somehow or other, if we can induce even one person to become Krishna conscious, then
that is success.
Srila Prabhupada also writes in Bhagavad Gita, if you see the preface of Bhagavad Gita, Prabhupada
writes in the last paragraph, I'll just read this. A living entity is happily the part
and parcel of the Lord and thus is not a part and parcel of the Lord. A living entity is
pleased with the good deeds of the Lord. A living entity is pleased with the good deeds
of the Lord and thus is not a part and parcel of the Lord. It is all the good deeds of the
Lord that are called as good deeds.
Do not try to understand the good deeds of the Lord, but simply understand the service
of the Lord.
By the spell of illusion, one tries to be happy by serving his personal sense gratification
in different forms, which will never make him happy, instead of satisfying his own
personal material senses, he has to satisfy the senses of the Lord. That is the highest
perfection.
of life. The Lord wants this and he demands it. One has to understand this central point
of Bhagavad Gita. This is a central point. What is that? Instead of satisfying our own
senses independently, we have to satisfy the senses of the Lord. This is central point
of Bhagavad Gita. Our Krishna consciousness movement is teaching the whole world this
central point and because we are not polluting the theme of Bhagavad Gita as it is, anyone
seriously interested in deriving benefit by studying the Bhagavad Gita must take help from
the Krishna consciousness movement for practical understanding of Bhagavad Gita under the direct
guidance of the Lord. We hope, therefore, that people will derive the greatest benefit
by studying Bhagavad Gita.
Bhagavad Gita, as it is, as we have presented it here, and if even one man becomes a pure
devotee of the Lord, we shall consider our attempt a success. So Prabhupada is writing,
if even one man becomes a pure devotee by studying this Bhagavad Gita as it is, then
Srila Prabhupada says, he considers it as a success. So that means we can see how difficult
it is.
The first step is to induce a conditioned soul to take up pure devotion to Krishna.
In one letter, Prabhupada writes to his disciple, in 1967, some senior disciples of Prabhupada
had left the movement, Kirtananda, Kirtananda, Hayagriva, like that some disciples had left
and Prabhupada has written one letter about how a spiritual master feels when a disciple
leaves and goes.
So Prabhupada writes, when you left us, I simply prayed to Krishna for your return to
Krishna consciousness because that was my duty.
Any good soul who approaches me once for spiritual enlightenment is supposed to be depending
on my responsibility to get him back, back to Krishna, back to home.
The disciple may misunderstand me.
The disciple may misunderstand me.
The disciple may misunderstand me.
The disciple may misunderstand me.
a bona fide spiritual master being obliged to do so under pressure of Maya's influence.
Even after accepting Guru, even after taking Deeksha, still disciple may come under Maya's influence.
And due to Maya's pressure, he may leave Guru and go away also.
But what Guru feels, Prabhupada is writing,
when a disciple misunderstands a bona fide spiritual master,
the master regrets for his inability to protect the disciple and sometimes he cries with tears in his eyes.
So spiritual master cries, when a disciple leaves him and goes away, he cries helplessly.
We had an experience while my Guru Maharaj was alive.
One of his disciples who accepted sanyasa was one day forcibly dragged by his wife.
My Guru Maharaj lamented with tears in his eyes saying that he could not save the soul.
So Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur, he had one disciple who was a sanyasi and wife came again.
Generally after taking sanyasa, sanyasi should not meet the wife.
But somehow this wife was very powerful, Maya.
She went and dragged him back and Guru started crying that he could not save that soul.
So we should always therefore be careful in the matter of being attacked by Maya's influence.
And the only means of guarantee is to chant Hare Krishna offenselessly.
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
So if we chant Hare Krishna mantra offenselessly, only then we are guaranteed of Maya's attack, protection of Maya's attack.
So this is the only way Prabhupada is writing.
But still we should be careful of the offences against chanting the holy name.
Prabhupada writes,
The greatest offence is to defy the spiritual master and to act sinfully, thinking in the strength of chanting.
If a man thinks that chanting will save him from all kinds of sinful reaction and deliberately commit sin, then he becomes greatest offender.
